.. class:: warningmark
Supplied Participant Barcodes are converted to their Sample Barcodes. NOTE: Most Normal samples do NOT have mRNA expression info and will return NA
.. class:: warningmark
Only TGCA valid Participant or Sample Barcodes are allowed WITHOUT a header row for Column Titles It allows both Participant or Sample Barcodes mixed together The Database table mRNA_UNC_HiSeq_RSEM generally has more data -----
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool takes a list of Sample Barcodes (converts Participant Barcodes if that is what is input) and obtains the sample Standard Deviation for all TCGA genes in the database. It normalizes the Standard Deviation for each gene based on the samples suppled. It manages a list of Percentile ranks for how much the specific Gene X's Standard Deviation is relatively higher that the other gene SD values. Depending on user Percentile Cutoff chosen one wil retrieve a Matrix of Sample Barcodes (columns) vs Genes (rows) with cell values of the actual Normalized Value or RPKM values (depending on the Table chosen) Percentile 100 is the gene values with the highest variability for the supplied sample. 0 retrieves the least variable. When no data is returned for a cell 'NA' is returned in the out matrix.
-----
**Example**
Inputing Sample Barcodes TCGA-GV-A3QK-01A TCGA-DK-A1A7-01A TCGA-XF-AAME-01A TCGA-E7-A97Q-10A and a study "BLCA"
will produce something like following matrix::
